intro: Lellingeria major, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 10–30 centimeters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Lellingeria major is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
